source.title: The Great Quake and the Great Drowning
source.author: Ann Finkbeiner

photo.desc: Storm weans over the Howe Sound looking down from The Cheif

divs.text: On the coast of what is now the state of Washington, Thunderbird and Whale had a fight,
This caused the mountains to shake and uprooted the trees. The ocean rose up and covered the whole land.
To the North on Vancouver Island, dwarfs who lived in a mountain were dancing around their drum.
When someone accidentally kicked the drum, they got "earthquake foot", thereafter causing an earquake with each step.
The land shook and the ocean flooded in.

Everything then drifted away, everything was lost and gone.

- Quileute, Hoh, Nuu-chah-nulth peoples
